ip.Description: An IP address that is the focus for the ACL

negated.Description: A boolean that will negate the match if true

subnet.Description: An optional subnet mask applied to the IP address

activate.Description: Conditionally prevents the Service from being activated

address.Description: An IPv4, hostname, or IPv6 address for the Backend

auto_loadbalance.Description: Should this Backend be load balanced

between_bytes_timeout.Description: How long to wait between bytes in milliseconds

connect_timeout.Description: How long to wait for a timeout in milliseconds

error_threshold.Description: Number of errors to allow before the Backend is marked as down

first_byte_timeout.Description: How long to wait for the first bytes in milliseconds

healthcheck.Description: The healthcheck name that should be used for this Backend

max_conn.Description: Maximum number of connections for this Backend

max_tls_version.Description: Maximum allowed TLS version on SSL connections to this backend.

min_tls_version.Description: Minimum allowed TLS version on SSL connections to this backend.

name.Description: A name for this Backend

override_host.Description: The hostname to override the Host header

port.Description: The port number Backend responds on. Default 80

shield.Description: The POP of the shield designated to reduce inbound load.

ssl_cert_hostname.Description: SSL certificate hostname for cert verification

ssl_check_cert.Description: Be strict on checking SSL certs

ssl_client_cert.Description: SSL certificate file for client connections to the backend.

ssl_client_key.Description: SSL key file for client connections to backend.

ssl_sni_hostname.Description: SSL certificate hostname for SNI verification

use_ssl.Description: Whether or not to use SSL to reach the Backend

weight.Description: The portion of traffic to send to a specific origins. Each origin receives weight/total of the traffic.

dataset.Description: The ID of your BigQuery dataset

email.Description: The email address associated with the target BigQuery dataset on your account.

name.Description: Unique name to refer to this logging setup

project_id.Description: The ID of your GCP project

secret_key.Description: The secret key associated with the target BigQuery dataset on your account.

table.Description: The ID of your BigQuery table

template.Description: Big query table name suffix template

account_name.Description: The unique Azure Blob Storage namespace in which your data objects are stored

container.Description: The name of the Azure Blob Storage container in which to store logs

message_type.Description: How the message should be formatted (default: `classic`)

name.Description: The unique name of the Azure Blob Storage logging endpoint

path.Description: The path to upload logs to. Must end with a trailing slash

period.Description: How frequently the logs should be transferred, in seconds (default: 3600)

public_key.Description: The PGP public key that Fastly will use to encrypt your log files before writing them to disk

sas_token.Description: The Azure shared access signature providing write access to the blob service objects

name.Description: The domain that this Service will respond to

bucket_name.Description: The name of the bucket in which to store the logs.

email.Description: The email address associated with the target GCS bucket on your account.

message_type.Description: The log message type per the fastly docs: https://docs.fastly.com/api/logging#logging_gcs

name.Description: Unique name to refer to this logging setup

path.Description: Path to store the files. Must end with a trailing slash

period.Description: How frequently the logs should be transferred, in seconds (Default 3600)

secret_key.Description: The secret key associated with the target gcs bucket on your account.

check_interval.Description: How often to run the healthcheck in milliseconds

expected_response.Description: The status code expected from the host

http_version.Description: Whether to use version 1.0 or 1.1 HTTP

initial.Description: When loading a config, the initial number of probes to be seen as OK

name.Description: A name to refer to this healthcheck

threshold.Description: How many healthchecks must succeed to be considered healthy

window.Description: The number of most recent healthcheck queries to keep for this healthcheck

content_type.Description: Content-Type header sent with the request.

header_name.Description: Custom header sent with the request.

header_value.Description: Value of the custom header sent with the request.

json_format.Description: Formats log entries as JSON. Can be either disabled (`0`), array of json (`1`), or newline delimited json (`2`).

message_type.Description: How the message should be formatted

name.Description: The unique name of the HTTPS logging endpoint

request_max_bytes.Description: The maximum number of bytes sent in one request.

request_max_entries.Description: The maximum number of logs sent in one request.

tls_ca_cert.Description: A secure certificate to authenticate the server with. Must be in PEM format.

tls_client_cert.Description: The client certificate used to make authenticated requests. Must be in PEM format.

tls_client_key.Description: The client private key used to make authenticated requests. Must be in PEM format.

tls_hostname.Description: The hostname used to verify the server's certificate. It can either be the Common Name (CN) or blockAttributes Subject Alternative Name (SAN).

url.Description: URL that log data will be sent to. Must use the https protocol.

name.Description: Unique name to refer to this logging setup

port.Description: The port number configured in Logentries

token.Description: Use token based authentication (https://logentries.com/doc/input-token/)

use_tls.Description: Whether to use TLS for secure logging

gzip_level.Description: What level of GZIP encoding to have when dumping logs (default 0, no compression).

path.Description: The path to upload logs to.

period.Description: How frequently log files are finalized so they can be available for reading (in seconds, default 3600).

region.Description: The region to stream logs to. One of: DFW	(Dallas), ORD (Chicago), IAD (Northern Virginia), LON (London), SYD (Sydney), HKG (Hong Kong).

timestamp_format.Description: The specified format of the log's timestamp (default `%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.000`).

user.Description: The username for your Cloudfile account.

name.Description: The unique name of the Kafka logging endpoint.

required_acks.Description: The Number of acknowledgements blockAttributes leader must receive before blockAttributes write is considered successful. One of: 1 (default) One server needs to respond. 0 No servers need to respond. -1	Wait for all in-sync replicas to respond.

secret_key.Description: Your Google Cloud Platform account secret key. The private_key field in your service account authentication JSON.

topic.Description: The Google Cloud Pub/Sub topic to which logs will be published.

user.Description: Your Google Cloud Platform service account email address. The client_email field in your service account authentication JSON.

format.Description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting.

format_version.Description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either `1` or `2`. (default: `2`).

name.Description: The unique name of the Heroku logging endpoint.

placement.Description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed. Can be `none` or `waf_debug`.

response_condition.Description: The name of an existing condition in the configured endpoint, or leave blank to always execute.

token.Description: The token to use for authentication (https://www.heroku.com/docs/customer-token-authentication-token/).

url.Description: The url to stream logs to.

dataset.Description: The Honeycomb Dataset you want to log to.

format.Description: Apache style log formatting. Your log must produce valid JSON that Honeycomb can ingest.

format_version.Description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either `1` or `2`. (default: `2`).

name.Description: The unique name of the Honeycomb logging endpoint.

placement.Description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed. Can be `none` or `waf_debug`.

response_condition.Description: The name of an existing condition in the configured endpoint, or leave blank to always execute.

token.Description: The Write Key from the Account page of your Honeycomb account.

brokers.Description: A comma-separated list of IP addresses or hostnames of Kafka brokers.

compression_codec.Description: The codec used for compression of your logs. One of: gzip, snappy, lz4.

format.Description: Apache style log formatting.

format_version.Description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 or 2. (default: 2).

name.Description: The unique name of the Kafka logging endpoint.

placement.Description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed.

required_acks.Description: The Number of acknowledgements blockAttributes leader must receive before blockAttributes write is considered successful. One of: 1 (default) One server needs to respond. 0 No servers need to respond. -1	Wait for all in-sync replicas to respond.

response_condition.Description: The name of an existing condition in the configured endpoint, or leave blank to always execute.

tls_ca_cert.Description: A secure certificate to authenticate the server with. Must be in PEM format.

tls_client_cert.Description: The client certificate used to make authenticated requests. Must be in PEM format.

tls_client_key.Description: The client private key used to make authenticated requests. Must be in PEM format.

tls_hostname.Description: The hostname used to verify the server's certificate. It can either be the Common Name or blockAttributes Subject Alternative Name (SAN).

topic.Description: The Kafka topic to send logs to.

use_tls.Description: Whether to use TLS for secure logging. Can be either true or false.

format.Description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting.

format_version.Description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either `1` or `2`. (default: `2`).

name.Description: The unique name of the Loggly logging endpoint.

placement.Description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed. Can be `none` or `waf_debug`.

response_condition.Description: The name of an existing condition in the configured endpoint, or leave blank to always execute.

token.Description: The token to use for authentication (https://www.loggly.com/docs/customer-token-authentication-token/).

format.Description: Apache style log formatting.

format_version.Description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either `1` or `2`. (default: `2`).

name.Description: The unique name of the Log Shuttle logging endpoint.

placement.Description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed. Can be `none` or `waf_debug`.

response_condition.Description: The name of an existing condition in the configured endpoint, or leave blank to always execute.

token.Description: The data authentication token associated with this endpoint.

format.Description: Apache style log formatting. Your log must produce valid JSON that New Relic Logs can ingest.

format_version.Description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either `1` or `2`. (default: `2`).

name.Description: The unique name of the New Relic logging endpoint

placement.Description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed.

response_condition.Description: The name of the condition to apply.

token.Description: The Insert API key from the Account page of your New Relic account.

bucket_name.Description: The name of your OpenStack container.

format.Description: Apache style log formatting.

format_version.Description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either `1` or `2`. (default: `2`).

gzip_level.Description: What level of Gzip encoding to have when dumping logs (default 0, no compression).

message_type.Description: How the message should be formatted. One of: classic (default), loggly, logplex or blank.

name.Description: The unique name of the OpenStack logging endpoint.

path.Description: The path to upload logs to.

period.Description: How frequently log files are finalized so they can be available for reading (in seconds, default 3600).

placement.Description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed. Can be `none` or `waf_debug`.

public_key.Description: A PGP public key that Fastly will use to encrypt your log files before writing them to disk.

response_condition.Description: The name of an existing condition in the configured endpoint, or leave blank to always execute.

user.Description: The username for your OpenStack account.

format.Description: Apache style log formatting.

format_version.Description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 or 2. (default: 2).

name.Description: The unique name of the Scalyr logging endpoint.

placement.Description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed.

region.Description: The region that log data will be sent to. One of US or EU. Defaults to US if undefined.

response_condition.Description: The name of an existing condition in the configured endpoint, or leave blank to always execute.

token.Description: The token to use for authentication (https://www.scalyr.com/keys).

address.Description: The SFTP address to stream logs to.

format.Description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting.

format_version.Description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 or 2. (default: 2).

gzip_level.Description: What level of GZIP encoding to have when dumping logs (default 0, no compression).

message_type.Description: How the message should be formatted. One of: classic (default), loggly, logplex or blank.

name.Description: The unique name of the SFTP logging endpoint.

password.Description: The password for the server. If both password and secret_key are passed, secret_key will be preferred.

path.Description: The path to upload log files to. If the path ends in / then it is treated as blockAttributes directory.

period.Description: How frequently log files are finalized so they can be available for reading (in seconds, default 3600).

placement.Description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed.

port.Description: The port the SFTP service listens on. (Default: 22).

public_key.Description: A PGP public key that Fastly will use to encrypt your log files before writing them to disk.

response_condition.Description: The name of the condition to apply.

secret_key.Description: The SSH private key for the server. If both password and secret_key are passed, secret_key will be preferred.

ssh_known_hosts.Description: A list of host keys for all hosts we can connect to over SFTP.

name.Description: Unique name for this Service

address.Description: The address of the papertrail service

format.Description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting

name.Description: Unique name to refer to this logging setup

placement.Description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed.

port.Description: The port of the papertrail service

response_condition.Description: Name of blockAttributes condition to apply this logging

action.Description: Allows you to terminate request handling and immediately perform an action

force_miss.Description: Force a cache miss for the request

hash_keys.Description: Comma separated list of varnish request object fields that should be in the hash key

max_stale_age.Description: How old an object is allowed to be, in seconds. Default `60`

name.Description: Unique name to refer to this Request Setting

request_condition.Description: Name of a request condition to apply. If there is no condition this setting will always be applied.

timer_support.Description: Injects the X-Timer info into the request

cache_condition.Description: Name of the condition checked after we have retrieved an object. If the condition passes then deliver this Request Object instead.

content.Description: The content to deliver for the response object

content_type.Description: The MIME type of the content

name.Description: Unique name to refer to this request object

request_condition.Description: Name of the condition to be checked during the request phase to see if the object should be delivered

response.Description: The HTTP Response of the object

status.Description: The HTTP Status Code of the object

bucket_name.Description: S3 Bucket name to store logs in.

format.Description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting.

format_version.Description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 or 2. (Default: 1).

message_type.Description: How the message should be formatted.

name.Description: The unique name of the S3 logging endpoint.

path.Description: Path to store the files. Must end with blockAttributes trailing slash.

period.Description: How frequently the logs should be transferred, in seconds (Default 3600).

placement.Description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed.

public_key.Description: A PGP public key that Fastly will use to encrypt your log files before writing them to disk.

response_condition.Description: Name of blockAttributes condition to apply this logging.

server_side_encryption.Description: Specify what type of server side encryption should be used. Can be either `AES256` or `aws:kms`.

server_side_encryption_kms_key_id.Description: Optional server-side KMS Key Id. Must be set if server_side_encryption is set to `aws:kms`.

content.Description: The contents of the VCL snippet

name.Description: A unique name to refer to this VCL snippet

priority.Description: Determines ordering for multiple snippets. Lower priorities execute first. (Default: 100)

type.Description: One of init, recv, hit, miss, pass, fetch, error, deliver, log, none

format.Description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting (default: `%h %l %u %t "%r" %>s %b`)

format_version.Description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 or 2. (default: 2)

name.Description: The unique name of the Splunk logging endpoint

placement.Description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed

response_condition.Description: The name of the condition to apply

tls_ca_cert.Description: A secure certificate to authenticate the server with. Must be in PEM format. You can provide this certificate via an environment variable, `FASTLY_SPLUNK_CA_CERT`.

tls_hostname.Description: The hostname used to verify the server's certificate. It can either be the Common Name or blockAttributes Subject Alternative Name (SAN).

token.Description: The Splunk token to be used for authentication

url.Description: The Splunk URL to stream logs to

format.Description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting

format_version.Description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 or 2. (Default: 1)

message_type.Description: How the message should be formatted.

name.Description: Unique name to refer to this logging setup

placement.Description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed.

response_condition.Description: Name of blockAttributes condition to apply this logging.

address.Description: The address of the syslog service

format.Description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting

format_version.Description: The version of the custom logging format. Can be either 1 or 2. (Default: 1)

message_type.Description: How the message should be formatted.

name.Description: Unique name to refer to this logging setup

placement.Description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed.

port.Description: The port of the syslog service

response_condition.Description: Name of blockAttributes condition to apply this logging.

tls_ca_cert.Description: A secure certificate to authenticate the server with. Must be in PEM format.

tls_client_cert.Description: The client certificate used to make authenticated requests. Must be in PEM format.

tls_client_key.Description: The client private key used to make authenticated requests. Must be in PEM format.

tls_hostname.Description: Used during the TLS handshake to validate the certificate.

token.Description: Authentication token

content.Description: The contents of this VCL configuration

main.Description: Should this VCL configuration be the main configuration

name.Description: A name to refer to this VCL configuration

login.Description: The email address, which is the login name, of this user.

name.Description: The real life name of the user.

role.Description: The user-assigned permissions role. Can be `user` (the default), `billing`, `engineer`, or `superuser`.
